sources.title: The Mandarin Mystery
sources.description: This adaptation of an Ellery Queen mystery concerns the theft of a rare Chinese stamp (the Mandarin of the title), which takes place in a hotel with several shifty characters and an hysterical manager (the priceless Franklin Pangborn). The mystery, such as it is, concerns both the stamp theft and two murders, and shows Ellery and his father the Inspector as a team rubbing together just enough to solve the case.

sources.title: The Mandarin Mystery (1936) DETECTIVE
sources.description:
Stars: Eddie Quillan, Charlotte Henry, Rita La Roy 
 Director: Ralph Staub

 Legendary detective Ellery Queen sets out to solve a mystery involving an extremely valuable stamp.

sources.title: THE MANDARIN MYSTERY Image Quality Upgrade
sources.description: The flat contrast and brightness of the existing IA print as been considerably enhanced. A lively and entertaining whodunit in spite of the miscasting of Eddie Quillan as Ellery Queen. Charlotte Henry costars at the head of a large cast. The complex plot is loosely based on Frederic Dannay’s novel “The Mandarin Orange Mystery.” IMDB rating 5.3. Directed by Ralph Staub.  Released in 1936.   Complete print. TRIVIA: First telecast on March 13, 1953 on WABC NYC.

metadata.Plot: A very rare and priceless Chinese postage stamp is stole as its thief claims two victims in a hotel,, both of whom are murdered in inexplicably locked rooms. Young Ellery romances the stamps beautiful owner, Josephie Temple, while working with his father, Inspector Queen to solve the baffling case and expose the killer.
metadata.Writer: Frederic Dannay, Manfred Lee, John Francis Larkin
metadata.Actors: Eddie Quillan, Charlotte Henry, Rita La Roy
